children.subject: I recommend taking 170 after 61B if you can. 170 largely starts off the end of 61B.

history.content:
Doing that right now. Couple of friends also in it.
Contrary to what the TA said below, 170 reviews and reteaches (very quickly, do not as much time to digest) everything you learnt in 61b, except with less handwaving. Having gone through 61b before 170 would definitely help though.
If you've done contest programming like usaco, then both classes will likely be breazy, by the fact that you know how to tackle algorthmic problems (170), and be able to write and debug code (61b).

If you can consider doing both, I'm guessing you are capable of doing both. The plus side of doing so would be that 170 trivializes everything past midterm 1 of 61b.

If you've done contest programming like usaco, then both classes will likely be breazy, by the fact that you know how to tackle algorthmic problems (170), and be able to write and debug code (61b).

If you can consider doing both, I'm guessing you are capable of doing both. The plus side of doing so would be that 170 trivializes everything past midterm 1 of 61b.
As title, I plan to take 61B with Prof. Hilfinger at Fall 2019. Thanks for advice! I think I will preview the materials in 61B during the summer.
history.subject: How doable is 61B + 170?
